Chapter.Label: Installing Semigroups
Chapter.Heading: Installing &Semigroups;
Chapter.Section:
For those in a hurry In this section we give a brief description of how to start using &Semigroups;.
It is assumed that you have a working copy of &GAP; with version number &GAPVERS; or higher. The most up-to-date version of &GAP; and instructions on how to install it can be obtained from the main &GAP; webpage http://www.gap-system.org.
The following is a summary of the steps that should lead to a successful installation of &Semigroups;:
ensure that the &IO; package version &IOVERS; or higher is available. &IO; must be compiled before &Semigroups; can be loaded.
ensure that the &Orb; package version &ORBVERS; or higher is available. &Orb; and &Semigroups; both perform better if &Orb; is compiled.
ensure that the &Digraphs; package version &DIGRAPHSVERS; or higher is available. &Digraphs; must be compiled before &Semigroups; can be loaded.
ensure that the &genss; package version &GENSSVERS; or higher is available.
This step is optional: certain functions in &Semigroups; require the &Grape; package to be available and fully compiled; see Section for full details. To use these functions make sure that the &Grape; package version &GRAPEVERS; or higher is available. If &Grape; is not fully installed (i.e. compiled), then &Semigroups; can be used as normal with the exception that the functions listed in Subsection will not work.
download the package archive &ARCHIVENAME;.tar.gz from http://www-groups.mcs.st-andrews.ac.uk/~jamesm/semigroups.php.
unzip and untar the file, this should create a directory called &ARCHIVENAME;.
locate the pkg directory of your &GAP; directory, which contains the directories lib, doc and so on. Move the directory &ARCHIVENAME; into the pkg directory.
from Version ??, it is necessary to compile the &Semigroups; package. Inside the pkg/&ARCHIVENAME; directory, type
./configure make Further information about this step can be found in Section .
start &GAP; in the usual way (i.e. type gap at the command line).
type LoadPackage("semigroups");
Please note that from Version ??: &Semigroups; can only be loaded if it has been compiled.
If you want to check that the package is working correctly, you should run some of the tests described in Section .

Optional package dependencies
The &Semigroups; package is written in &GAP; and C++ code and requires the &Orb; and &IO; packages. The &Orb; package is used to efficiently compute components of actions, which underpin many of the features of &Semigroups;. The &IO; package is used to read and write transformations, partial permutations, and bipartitions to a file.

The genss package
The &genss; package is used in a non-deterministic version of the operation and in calculating the stabiliser of a Rees 0-matrix semigroup's matrix. It must be installed for &Semigroups; to load.

Compiling the kernel module As of version ??, the &Semigroups; package has a &GAP; kernel component in C/C++ which should be compiled. This component contains low-level functions relating to the enumeration of certain types of semigroups, and and it is not possible to use the &Semigroups; package without compiling it.
To compile the kernel component inside the pkg/&ARCHIVENAME; directory, type
./configure make
If you installed the package in another 'pkg' directory than the standard 'pkg' directory in your &GAP; installation, then you have to do two things. Firstly during compilation you have to use the option '--with-gaproot=PATH' of the 'configure' script where 'PATH' is a path to the main GAP root directory (if not given the default '../..' is assumed).
If you installed &GAP; on several architectures, you must execute the configure/make step for each of the architectures. You can either do this immediately after configuring and compiling GAP itself on this architecture, or alternatively (when using version 4.5 of GAP or newer) set the environment variable 'CONFIGNAME' to the name of the configuration you used when compiling GAP before running './configure'. Note however that your compiler choice and flags (environment variables 'CC' and 'CFLAGS') need to be chosen to match the setup of the original GAP compilation. For example you have to specify 32-bit or 64-bit mode correctly!

Testing your installation
In this section we describe how to test that &Semigroups; is working as intended. To test that &Semigroups; is installed correctly use or for more extensive tests use . Please note that it will take a few seconds for to finish and it may take several minutes for to finish.
If something goes wrong, then please review the instructions in Section and ensure that &Semigroups; has been properly installed. If you continue having problems, please use the http://bitbucket.org/james-d-mitchell/semigroups/issues to report the issues you are having.
